metadata.Title: CVE-2018-6056 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Type confusion could lead to a heap out-of-bounds write in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 64.0.3282.168 allowing a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code inside a sandbox via a crafted HTML page.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-6056` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 64.0.3282.167-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 64.0.3282.167-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 64.0.3282.167-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 64.0.3282.167-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 64.0.3282.167-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mikesalvatore> The Ubuntu Security Team does not support libv8

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '64.0.3282.167-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'libv8 not supported').
oxide-qt: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'Ubuntu touch end-of-life').
